summary: This bill, the Conservation for Agricultural Leased Land Act (CALL Act), directs the Secretary of Agriculture to conduct a study on barriers to conservation practice adoption on leased agricultural land. The study will review existing research, identify various leasing relationships, examine leasing models, consider regional variations, assess incentives and programs (federal, state and local), and assess the effects of competition. The Secretary will submit a report to Congress with findings and recommendations, including those that can be implemented under existing authorities, those requiring congressional authorization, and outreach strategies. The study gives consideration for farmers and ranchers who are people of color, including Black and indigenous farmers and ranchers, and beginning farmers and ranchers.
